TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ImportOptions extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Represents the options that can be set on an .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.XsdDataContractImporter> is used to generate code from XML schema using the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] CodeDOM. To generate an XML schema from an assembly, use the <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.XsdDataContractExporter>.
For more information about importing and exporting schemas, see [Schema Import and Export](~/docs/framework/wcf/feature-details/schema-import-and-export.md) and [Importing Schema to Generate Classes](~/docs/framework/wcf/feature-details/importing-schema-to-generate-classes.md).
## Examples The following example creates an instance of the <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.ImportOptions> class and sets the <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.ImportOptions.EnableDataBinding%2A> and <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.ImportOptions.GenerateInternal%2A> properties.
[!code-csharp[XsdDataContractImporter#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/xsddatacontractimporter/cs/xsddatacontractimporterexample.cs#3)] [!code-vb[XsdDataContractImporter#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CFX/xsddatacontractimporter/vb/xsddatacontractimporterexample.vb#3)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
Gets or sets a instance that provides the means to check whether particular options for a target language are supported.
Docs.value: A that provides the means to check whether particular options for a target language are supported.

remarks.format: ## Remarks To support better code generation for different languages, information about what is supported by the target language needs to be passed to the schema importer. This is done by passing an instance of the <xref:System.CodeDom.Compiler.CodeDomProvider> class, which provides a <xref:System.CodeDom.Compiler.CodeDomProvider.Supports%2A> method to check whether it supports particular <xref:System.CodeDom.Compiler.CodeGeneratorOptions>.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a data contract surrogate that can be used to modify the code generated during an import operation.
Docs.value: An implementation of the interface that handles schema import.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether types in generated code should implement the interface.
Docs.value: if the generated code should implement the interface; otherwise, . The default is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks This interface is used by [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] components, such as Windows Forms or Windows Presentation Foundation, to capture data changes for user interface updates. The generated properties raise a property-changed event when the value changes, allowing UI hooks to act accordingly.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether generated code will be marked internal or public.
Docs.value: if the code will be marked ; otherwise, . The default is .

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether generated data contract classes will be marked with the attribute in addition to the attribute.
Docs.value: to generate classes with the applied; otherwise, . The default is .

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines whether all XML schema types, even those that do not conform to a data contract schema, will be imported.
Docs.value: to import all schema types; otherwise, . The default is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks Normally, importing a type that does not conform to a valid data contract schema will fail. However, when this property is set to `true`, all such types will be imported as types that implement the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.IXmlSerializable> interface.

Docs.summary: Gets a dictionary that contains the mapping of data contract namespaces to the CLR namespaces that must be used to generate code during an import operation.
Docs.value: A that contains the namespace mappings.

Docs.summary: Gets a collection of types that represents data contract collections that should be referenced when generating code for collections, such as lists or dictionaries of items.
Docs.value: An that contains the referenced collection types.

remarks.format: ## Remarks By default, an array will be generated when importing a collection schema (unless the schema has a special annotation that mentions a different type). However, if there is a matching type in the <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.ImportOptions.ReferencedCollectionTypes%2A> collection, that type will be used. For example, when importing schema that contains a list of integers, an array of integers will normally be generated. However, if the collection contains the <xref:System.Collections.Generic.LinkedList%601> of type integer, that type will be used instead of the array.

Docs.summary: Gets a containing types referenced in generated code.
Docs.value: A that contains the referenced types.
